intro: Zeyhera, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and consists of several species, including Zeyhera capensis and Zeyhera monticola. The plants are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow and orange. They typically grow in coastal areas and have a succulent, fleshy appearance adapted to arid conditions. Zeyhera species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
